item.title: [HEG] HEG Ltd. Violates SEBI Regulations: Designated Persons' Trading Infringements
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

HEG Ltd. has reported violations of the SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015, and its Code of Conduct for Regulating, Monitoring & Reporting Trading by Insiders. The violations were committed by designated persons in accordance with SEBI Circular No. SEBI/HO/ISD/ISD/CIR/P/2020/135 dated July 23, 2020. The violations include trading without pre-clearance, contra trade, and non-disclosure of transactions to the Company. The Company has advised the concerned persons to sell their entire equity shares of HEG Limited and deposit the sale proceeds into the designated account of the SEBI. The Company has also directed the concerned persons to inform their Portfolio Management Services (PMS) provider or broker to place the scrip of HEG Limited on the restricted/negative list.

  • HEG Ltd. reports violations of SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015, and its Code of Conduct for Regulating, Monitoring & Reporting Trading by Insiders.
  • Designated persons committed violations involving trading without pre-clearance, contra trade, and non-disclosure of transactions to the Company.
  • Company directs concerned persons to sell their entire equity shares of HEG Limited and deposit the sale proceeds into the designated account of the SEBI.
  • Company advises concerned persons to inform their PMS provider or broker to place the scrip of HEG Limited on the restricted/negative list.
  • Corrective and preventive measures are taken to ensure regulatory compliance, uphold corporate governance, and maintain market integrity.

item.title: [VADILALIND] Vadilal Industries Independent Director, Shivakumar Dega, Resigns Over Non-Compliance with Minimum Wage Act
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Vadilal Industries Ltd. announced the resignation of its independent director, Mr. Shivakumar Dega, due to the company's non-compliance with the Minimum Wages Act 1948 and Code of Wages 2019. Mr. Dega expressed his concerns in his resignation letter dated February 17, 2026, stating that the company has been paying its factory workers less than the minimum wage, which is a serious offence under Indian law. This violation has resulted in potential legal action for forced labour under Article 23 of the Indian Constitution. Despite raising the issue in several meetings and putting it down in writing, the board has not acted in the interests of all shareholders and the factory workers. The company is trying to stretch this liability over 2 to 4 years, which Mr. Dega strongly opposes. The board, however, seems unhappy with Mr. Dega for raising the minimum wage issue.

  • Vadilal Industries independent director, Mr. Shivakumar Dega, resigns over non-compliance with Minimum Wages Act 1948 and Code of Wages 2019.
  • Company has been paying its factory workers less than the minimum wage, a serious offence under Indian law.
  • Potential legal action for forced labour under Article 23 of the Indian Constitution.
  • Despite raising the issue in several meetings, the board has not acted in the interests of all shareholders and the factory workers.
  • Company trying to stretch this liability over 2 to 4 years, which Mr. Dega strongly opposes.

item.title: [STANCAP] Standard Capital Markets Ltd Redeems Rs 850000000 Worth of 10% Secured Non-Convertible Debentures
item.description:
Standard Capital Markets Ltd has successfully redeemed its 8500 NCDs, amounting to Rs 850000000, in compliance with Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosures Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The redemption was approved by the Board of Directors in a circulation held on February 21, 2026. The Secured, Unlisted, Unrated, Redeemable Non-convertible Debentures, with a face value of Rs. 100,000/-, were allotted to the holder during the period from 30th October, 2024 to 14th February, 2025. The Company has undertaken this redemption as per the terms and conditions laid down at the time of issue. The balance post redemption of 10% Secured Non-Convertible Debentures is now 48,702 Debentures.

item.title: [GRERENEW] GRE Renew Enertech Ltd Approves Transfer of Ownership for Partially Developed Solar Power Project
item.description:
GRE Renew Enertech Ltd has approved the transfer of ownership and execution of a settlement agreement with Mehsana Dairy and Food Products Limited for a partially developed solar power project. The transfer is due to the withdrawal of the party from the project. Upon completion, the project will be recognized in the company's books as stock-in-trade or project work-in-progress, pending its onward sale and execution of the balance Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) scope. The company has also received board approval for the proposed onward sale or transfer of the said partially developed solar power project to an identified potential client, subject to finalization and execution of definitive agreements.

  • GRE Renew Enertech Ltd approves transfer of ownership for a partially developed solar power project.
  • The transfer is due to the withdrawal of Mehsana Dairy and Food Products Limited from the project.
